Hebrew: <big>שִׁ֥</big>יר הַשִּׁירִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִשְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: The Song of Songs, by Solomon.
Transliteration: <big>shi</big>yr hashiyriym asher lishelomoh

Hebrew: יִשָּׁקֵ֙נִי֙ מִנְּשִׁיק֣וֹת פִּ֔יהוּ כִּֽי־טוֹבִ֥ים דֹּדֶ֖יךָ מִיָּֽיִן׃
Translated:
Oh, give me of the kisses of your mouth,
For your love is more delightful than wine.
Transliteration: yishakeniy mineshiykvot fiyhu khiy-tvoviym dodeykha miyayiin

Hebrew: לְרֵ֙יחַ֙ שְׁמָנֶ֣יךָ טוֹבִ֔ים שֶׁ֖מֶן תּוּרַ֣ק שְׁמֶ֑ךָ עַל־כֵּ֖ן עֲלָמ֥וֹת אֲהֵבֽוּךָ׃
Translated:
Your ointments yield a sweet fragrance,
Your name is like finest oil—
Therefore do maidens love you.
Transliteration: lereycha shemaneykha tvoviym shemen turak shemekha al-khen alamvot ahevukha

Hebrew: מׇשְׁכֵ֖נִי אַחֲרֶ֣יךָ נָּר֑וּצָה הֱבִיאַ֨נִי הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ חֲדָרָ֗יו נָגִ֤ילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ נַזְכִּ֤ירָה דֹדֶ֙יךָ֙ מִיַּ֔יִן מֵישָׁרִ֖ים אֲהֵבֽוּךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Draw me after you, let us run!
The king has brought me to his chambers.
Let us delight and rejoice in your love,
Savoring it more than wine—
Like new wine they love you!
Transliteration: mׇshekheniy achareykha narutsah heviyaniy hamelekhe chadarayv nagiylah venishemechah vakhe nazekhiyrah dodeykha miyayiin meyshariym ahevukha {f}

Hebrew: שְׁחוֹרָ֤ה אֲנִי֙ וְֽנָאוָ֔ה בְּנ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כְּאׇהֳלֵ֣י קֵדָ֔ר כִּירִיע֖וֹת שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated:
I am dark, but comely,
O daughters of Jerusalem—
Like the tents of Kedar,
Like the pavilions of Solomon.
Transliteration: shechvorah aniy venavah venvot yerushala͏im kheׇholey kedar khiyriyvot shelomoh

Hebrew: אַל־תִּרְא֙וּנִי֙ שֶׁאֲנִ֣י שְׁחַרְחֹ֔רֶת שֶׁשְּׁזָפַ֖תְנִי הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ בְּנֵ֧י אִמִּ֣י נִֽחֲרוּ־בִ֗י שָׂמֻ֙נִי֙ נֹטֵרָ֣ה אֶת־הַכְּרָמִ֔ים כַּרְמִ֥י שֶׁלִּ֖י לֹ֥א נָטָֽרְתִּי׃
Translated:
Don’t stare at me because I am swarthy,
Because the sun has gazed upon me.
My mother’s sons quarreled with me,
They made me guard the vineyards;
My own vineyard I did not guard.
Transliteration: al-tireuniy sheaniy shecharechoret sheshezafateniy hashamesh veney imiy nicharu-viy shamuniy noterah et-hakheramiym kharemiy sheliy lo nataretiy

Hebrew: הַגִּ֣ידָה לִּ֗י שֶׁ֤אָֽהֲבָה֙ נַפְשִׁ֔י אֵיכָ֣ה תִרְעֶ֔ה אֵיכָ֖ה תַּרְבִּ֣יץ בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם שַׁלָּמָ֤ה אֶֽהְיֶה֙ כְּעֹ֣טְיָ֔ה עַ֖ל עֶדְרֵ֥י חֲבֵרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Tell me, you whom I love so well;
Where do you pasture your sheep?
Where do you rest them at noon?
Let me not be as one who strays
Beside the flocks of your fellows.
Transliteration: hagiydah liy sheahavah nafeshiy eykhah tireeh eykhah tareviyts vatsׇhorayiim shalamah eheyeh kheoteyah al ederey chavereykha

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א תֵֽדְעִי֙ לָ֔ךְ הַיָּפָ֖ה בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים צְֽאִי־לָ֞ךְ בְּעִקְבֵ֣י הַצֹּ֗אן וּרְעִי֙ אֶת־גְּדִיֹּתַ֔יִךְ עַ֖ל מִשְׁכְּנ֥וֹת הָרֹעִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
If you do not know, O fairest of women,
Go follow the tracks of the sheep,
And graze your kids
By the tents of the shepherds.
Transliteration: im-lo tedeiy lakhe hayafah vanashiym tseiy-lakhe veikevey hatson ureiy et-gediyotayiikhe al mishekhenvot haroiym {f}

Hebrew: לְסֻֽסָתִי֙ בְּרִכְבֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה דִּמִּיתִ֖יךְ רַעְיָתִֽי׃
Translated:
I have likened you, my darling,
To a mare in Pharaoh’s chariots:
Transliteration: lesusatiy verikhevey fareoh dimiytiykhe raeyatiy

Hebrew: נָאו֤וּ לְחָיַ֙יִךְ֙ בַּתֹּרִ֔ים צַוָּארֵ֖ךְ בַּחֲרוּזִֽים׃
Translated:
Your cheeks are comely with plaited wreaths,
Your neck with strings of jewels.
Transliteration: navu lechayayiikhe vatoriym tsavarekhe vacharuziym

Hebrew: תּוֹרֵ֤י זָהָב֙ נַֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֔ךְ עִ֖ם נְקֻדּ֥וֹת הַכָּֽסֶף׃
Translated:
We will add wreaths of gold
To your spangles of silver.
Transliteration: tvorey zahav naasheh-lakhe im nekudvot hakhasef

Hebrew: עַד־שֶׁ֤הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בִּמְסִבּ֔וֹ נִרְדִּ֖י נָתַ֥ן רֵיחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
While the king was on his couch,
My nard gave forth its fragrance.
Transliteration: ad-shehamelekhe vimesivvo nirediy natan reychvo

Hebrew: צְר֨וֹר הַמֹּ֤ר <small>׀</small> דּוֹדִי֙ לִ֔י בֵּ֥ין שָׁדַ֖י יָלִֽין׃
Translated:
My beloved to me is a bag of myrrh
Lodged between my breasts.
Transliteration: tservor hamor <small></small> dvodiy liy veyn shaday yaliyn

Hebrew: אֶשְׁכֹּ֨ל הַכֹּ֤פֶר ׀ דּוֹדִי֙ לִ֔י בְּכַרְמֵ֖י עֵ֥ין גֶּֽדִי׃ {ס}
Translated:
My beloved to me is a spray of henna blooms
From the vineyards of En-gedi.
Transliteration: eshekhol hakhofer dvodiy liy vekharemey eyn gediy {s}

Hebrew: הִנָּ֤ךְ יָפָה֙ רַעְיָתִ֔י הִנָּ֥ךְ יָפָ֖ה עֵינַ֥יִךְ יוֹנִֽים׃
Translated:
Ah, you are fair, my darling,
Ah, you are fair,
With your dove-like eyes!
Transliteration: hinakhe yafah raeyatiy hinakhe yafah eynayiikhe yvoniym

Hebrew: הִנְּךָ֨ יָפֶ֤ה דוֹדִי֙ אַ֣ף נָעִ֔ים אַף־עַרְשֵׂ֖נוּ רַעֲנָנָֽה׃
Translated:
And you, my beloved, are handsome,
Beautiful indeed!
Our couch is in a bower;
Transliteration: hinekha yafeh dvodiy af naiym af-areshenu raananah

Hebrew: קֹר֤וֹת בָּתֵּ֙ינוּ֙ אֲרָזִ֔ים (רחיטנו) [רַהִיטֵ֖נוּ] בְּרוֹתִֽים׃
Translated:
Cedars are the beams of our house,
Cypresses the rafters.
Transliteration: korvot vateynu araziym (rchytnv) [rahiytenu] vervotiym

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ חֲבַצֶּ֣לֶת הַשָּׁר֔וֹן שׁוֹשַׁנַּ֖ת הָעֲמָקִֽים׃
Translated:
I am a rose of Sharon,
A lily of the valleys.
Transliteration: aniy chavatselet hasharvon shvoshanat haamakiym

Hebrew: כְּשֽׁוֹשַׁנָּה֙ בֵּ֣ין הַחוֹחִ֔ים כֵּ֥ן רַעְיָתִ֖י בֵּ֥ין הַבָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Like a lily among thorns,
So is my darling among the maidens.
Transliteration: kheshvoshanah veyn hachvochiym khen raeyatiy veyn havanvot

Hebrew: כְּתַפּ֙וּחַ֙ בַּעֲצֵ֣י הַיַּ֔עַר כֵּ֥ן דּוֹדִ֖י בֵּ֣ין הַבָּנִ֑ים בְּצִלּוֹ֙ חִמַּ֣דְתִּי וְיָשַׁ֔בְתִּי וּפִרְי֖וֹ מָת֥וֹק לְחִכִּֽי׃
Translated:
Like an apple tree among trees of the forest,
So is my beloved among the youths.
I delight to sit in his shade,
And his fruit is sweet to my mouth.
Transliteration: khetafucha vaatsey hayaar khen dvodiy veyn havaniym vetsilvo chimadetiy veyashavetiy ufireyvo matvok lechikhiy

Hebrew: הֱבִיאַ֙נִי֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַיָּ֔יִן וְדִגְל֥וֹ עָלַ֖י אַהֲבָֽה׃
Translated:
He brought me to the banquet room
And his banner of love was over me.
Transliteration: heviyaniy el-veyt hayayiin vedigelvo alay ahavah

Hebrew: סַמְּכ֙וּנִי֙ בָּאֲשִׁישׁ֔וֹת רַפְּד֖וּנִי בַּתַּפּוּחִ֑ים כִּי־חוֹלַ֥ת אַהֲבָ֖ה אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
“Sustain me with raisin cakes,
Refresh me with apples,
For I am faint with love.”
Transliteration: samekhuniy vaashiyshvot rafeduniy vatafuchiym khiy-chvolat ahavah aniy

Hebrew: שְׂמֹאלוֹ֙ תַּ֣חַת לְרֹאשִׁ֔י וִימִינ֖וֹ תְּחַבְּקֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
His left hand was under my head,
His right arm embraced me.
Transliteration: shemolvo tachat leroshiy viymiynvo techavekeniy

Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֨עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֜ם בְּנ֤וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ בִּצְבָא֔וֹת א֖וֹ בְּאַיְל֣וֹת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה אִם־תָּעִ֧ירוּ ׀ וְֽאִם־תְּע֥וֹרְר֛וּ אֶת־הָאַהֲבָ֖ה עַ֥ד שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I adjure you, O maidens of Jerusalem,
By gazelles or by hinds of the field:
Do not wake or rouse
Love until it please!
Transliteration: hishevaetiy etekhem venvot yerushala͏im vitsevavot vo veayelvot hashadeh im-taiyru veim-tevoreru et-haahavah ad shetechefats {s}

Hebrew: ק֣וֹל דּוֹדִ֔י הִנֵּה־זֶ֖ה בָּ֑א מְדַלֵּג֙ עַל־הֶ֣הָרִ֔ים מְקַפֵּ֖ץ עַל־הַגְּבָעֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Hark! My beloved!
There he comes,
Leaping over mountains,
Bounding over hills.
Transliteration: kvol dvodiy hineh-zeh va medaleg al-hehariym mekafets al-hagevavot

Hebrew: דּוֹמֶ֤ה דוֹדִי֙ לִצְבִ֔י א֖וֹ לְעֹ֣פֶר הָאַיָּלִ֑ים הִנֵּה־זֶ֤ה עוֹמֵד֙ אַחַ֣ר כׇּתְלֵ֔נוּ מַשְׁגִּ֙יחַ֙ מִן־הַֽחַלֹּנ֔וֹת מֵצִ֖יץ מִן־הַחֲרַכִּֽים׃
Translated:
My beloved is like a gazelle
Or like a young stag.
There he stands behind our wall,
Gazing through the window,
Peering through the lattice.
Transliteration: dvomeh dvodiy litseviy vo leofer haayaliym hineh-zeh vomed achar khׇtelenu mashegiycha min-hachalonvot metsiyts min-hacharakhiym

Hebrew: עָנָ֥ה דוֹדִ֖י וְאָ֣מַר לִ֑י ק֥וּמִי לָ֛ךְ רַעְיָתִ֥י יָפָתִ֖י וּלְכִי־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
My beloved spoke thus to me,
“Arise, my darling;
My fair one, come away!
Transliteration: anah dvodiy veamar liy kumiy lakhe raeyatiy yafatiy ulekhiy-lakhe

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֥ה הַסְּתָ֖ו עָבָ֑ר הַגֶּ֕שֶׁם חָלַ֖ף הָלַ֥ךְ לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For now the winter is past,
The rains are over and gone.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh hasetav avar hageshem chalaf halakhe lvo

Hebrew: הַנִּצָּנִים֙ נִרְא֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ עֵ֥ת הַזָּמִ֖יר הִגִּ֑יעַ וְק֥וֹל הַתּ֖וֹר נִשְׁמַ֥ע בְּאַרְצֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
The blossoms have appeared in the land,
The time of pruning has come;
The song of the turtledove
Is heard in our land.
Transliteration: hanitsaniym nireu vaarets et hazamiyr higiya vekvol hatvor nishema vearetsenu

Hebrew: הַתְּאֵנָה֙ חָנְטָ֣ה פַגֶּ֔יהָ וְהַגְּפָנִ֥ים ׀ סְמָדַ֖ר נָ֣תְנוּ רֵ֑יחַ ק֥וּמִי (לכי) [לָ֛ךְ] רַעְיָתִ֥י יָפָתִ֖י וּלְכִי־לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
The green figs form on the fig tree,
The vines in blossom give off fragrance.
Arise, my darling;
My fair one, come away!
Transliteration: hateenah chanetah fageyha vehagefaniym semadar natenu reycha kumiy (lkhy) [lakhe] raeyatiy yafatiy ulekhiy-lakhe {s}

Hebrew: יוֹנָתִ֞י בְּחַגְוֵ֣י הַסֶּ֗לַע בְּסֵ֙תֶר֙ הַמַּדְרֵגָ֔ה הַרְאִ֙ינִי֙ אֶת־מַרְאַ֔יִךְ הַשְׁמִיעִ֖נִי אֶת־קוֹלֵ֑ךְ כִּֽי־קוֹלֵ֥ךְ עָרֵ֖ב וּמַרְאֵ֥יךְ נָאוֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
“O my dove, in the cranny of the rocks,
Hidden by the cliff,
Let me see your face,
Let me hear your voice;
For your voice is sweet
And your face is comely.”
Transliteration: yvonatiy vechagevey hasela veseter hamaderegah hareiyniy et-mareayiikhe hashemiyiniy et-kvolekhe khiy-kvolekhe arev umareeykhe naveh {s}

Hebrew: אֶֽחֱזוּ־לָ֙נוּ֙ שֻֽׁעָלִ֔ים שֻׁעָלִ֥ים קְטַנִּ֖ים מְחַבְּלִ֣ים כְּרָמִ֑ים וּכְרָמֵ֖ינוּ סְמָדַֽר׃
Translated:
Catch us the foxes,
The little foxes
That ruin the vineyards—
For our vineyard is in blossom.
Transliteration: echezu-lanu shualiym shualiym ketaniym mechaveliym kheramiym ukherameynu semadar

Hebrew: דּוֹדִ֥י לִי֙ וַאֲנִ֣י ל֔וֹ הָרֹעֶ֖ה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃
Translated:
My beloved is mine
And I am his
Who browses among the lilies.
Transliteration: dvodiy liy vaaniy lvo haroeh vashvoshaniym

Hebrew: עַ֤ד שֶׁיָּפ֙וּחַ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְנָ֖סוּ הַצְּלָלִ֑ים סֹב֩ דְּמֵה־לְךָ֨ דוֹדִ֜י לִצְבִ֗י א֛וֹ לְעֹ֥פֶר הָאַיָּלִ֖ים עַל־הָ֥רֵי בָֽתֶר׃ {ס}
Translated:
When the day blows gently
And the shadows flee,
Set out, my beloved,
Swift as a gazelle
Or a young stag,
For the hills of spices!
Transliteration: ad sheyafucha hayyvom venasu hatselaliym sov demeh-lekha dvodiy litseviy vo leofer haayaliym al-harey vater {s}

Hebrew: עַל־מִשְׁכָּבִי֙ בַּלֵּיל֔וֹת בִּקַּ֕שְׁתִּי אֵ֥ת שֶֽׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א מְצָאתִֽיו׃
Translated:
Upon my couch at night
I sought the one I love—
I sought, but found him not.
Transliteration: al-mishekhaviy valeylvot vikashetiy et sheahavah nafeshiy vikashetiyv velo metsatiyv

Hebrew: אָק֨וּמָה נָּ֜א וַאֲסוֹבְבָ֣ה בָעִ֗יר בַּשְּׁוָקִים֙ וּבָ֣רְחֹב֔וֹת אֲבַקְשָׁ֕ה אֵ֥ת שֶֽׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א מְצָאתִֽיו׃
Translated:
“I must rise and roam the town,
Through the streets and through the squares;
I must seek the one I love.”
I sought but found him not.
Transliteration: akumah na vaasvovevah vaiyr vashevakiym uvarechovvot avakeshah et sheahavah nafeshiy vikashetiyv velo metsatiyv

Hebrew: מְצָא֙וּנִי֙ הַשֹּׁ֣מְרִ֔ים הַסֹּבְבִ֖ים בָּעִ֑יר אֵ֛ת שֶֽׁאָהֲבָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י רְאִיתֶֽם׃
Translated:
I met the watchmen
Who patrol the town.
“Have you seen the one I love?”
Transliteration: metsauniy hashomeriym hasoveviym vaiyr et sheahavah nafeshiy reiytem

Hebrew: כִּמְעַט֙ שֶׁעָבַ֣רְתִּי מֵהֶ֔ם עַ֣ד שֶׁמָּצָ֔אתִי אֵ֥ת שֶֽׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י אֲחַזְתִּיו֙ וְלֹ֣א אַרְפֶּ֔נּוּ עַד־שֶׁ֤הֲבֵיאתִיו֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אִמִּ֔י וְאֶל־חֶ֖דֶר הוֹרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Scarcely had I passed them
When I found the one I love.
I held him fast, I would not let him go
Till I brought him to my mother’s house,
To the chamber of her who conceived me
Transliteration: khimeat sheavaretiy mehem ad shematsatiy et sheahavah nafeshiy achazetiyv velo arefenu ad-shehaveytiyv el-veyt imiy veel-cheder hvoratiy

Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֨עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֜ם בְּנ֤וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ בִּצְבָא֔וֹת א֖וֹ בְּאַיְל֣וֹת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה אִם־תָּעִ֧ירוּ ׀ וְֽאִם־תְּע֥וֹרְר֛וּ אֶת־הָאַהֲבָ֖ה עַ֥ד שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I adjure you, O maidens of Jerusalem,
By gazelles or by hinds of the field:
Do not wake or rouse
Love until it please!
Transliteration: hishevaetiy etekhem venvot yerushala͏im vitsevavot vo veayelvot hashadeh im-taiyru veim-tevoreru et-haahavah ad shetechefats {s}

Hebrew: מִ֣י זֹ֗את עֹלָה֙ מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר כְּתִֽימְר֖וֹת עָשָׁ֑ן מְקֻטֶּ֤רֶת מֹר֙ וּלְבוֹנָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל אַבְקַ֥ת רוֹכֵֽל׃
Translated:
Who is she that comes up from the desert
Like columns of smoke,
In clouds of myrrh and frankincense,
Of all the powders of the merchant?
Transliteration: miy zot olah min-hamidevar khetiymervot ashan mekuteret mor ulevvonah mikhol avekat rvokhel

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֗ה מִטָּתוֹ֙ שֶׁלִּשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה שִׁשִּׁ֥ים גִּבֹּרִ֖ים סָבִ֣יב לָ֑הּ מִגִּבֹּרֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
There is Solomon’s couch,
Encircled by sixty warriors
Of the warriors of Israel,
Transliteration: hineh mitatvo shelishelomoh shishiym givoriym saviyv lah migivorey yisherael

Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ אֲחֻ֣זֵי חֶ֔רֶב מְלֻמְּדֵ֖י מִלְחָמָ֑ה אִ֤ישׁ חַרְבּוֹ֙ עַל־יְרֵכ֔וֹ מִפַּ֖חַד בַּלֵּילֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
All of them trained in warfare,
Skilled in battle,
Each with sword on thigh
Because of terror by night.
Transliteration: khulam achuzey cherev melumedey milechamah iysh charevvo al-yerekhvo mifachad valeylvot {s}

Hebrew: אַפִּרְי֗וֹן עָ֤שָׂה לוֹ֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מֵעֲצֵ֖י הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
King Solomon made him a palanquin
Of wood from Lebanon.
Transliteration: afireyvon ashah lvo hamelekhe shelomoh meatsey halevanvon

Hebrew: עַמּוּדָיו֙ עָ֣שָׂה כֶ֔סֶף רְפִידָת֣וֹ זָהָ֔ב מֶרְכָּב֖וֹ אַרְגָּמָ֑ן תּוֹכוֹ֙ רָצ֣וּף אַהֲבָ֔ה מִבְּנ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
He made its posts of silver,
Its back of gold,
Its seat of purple wool.
Within, it was decked with love
By the maidens of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: amudayv ashah khesef refiydatvo zahav merekhavvo aregaman tvokhvo ratsuf ahavah mivenvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: צְאֶ֧נָה ׀ וּֽרְאֶ֛ינָה בְּנ֥וֹת צִיּ֖וֹן בַּמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה בָּעֲטָרָ֗ה שֶׁעִטְּרָה־לּ֤וֹ אִמּוֹ֙ בְּי֣וֹם חֲתֻנָּת֔וֹ וּבְי֖וֹם שִׂמְחַ֥ת לִבּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
O maidens of Zion, go forth
And gaze upon King Solomon
Wearing the crown that his mother
Gave him on his wedding day,
On his day of bliss.
Transliteration: tseenah ureeynah venvot tsiyyvon vamelekhe shelomoh vaatarah sheiterah-lvo imvo veyvom chatunatvo uveyvom shimechat livvo {s}

Hebrew: הִנָּ֨ךְ יָפָ֤ה רַעְיָתִי֙ הִנָּ֣ךְ יָפָ֔ה עֵינַ֣יִךְ יוֹנִ֔ים מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵ֑ךְ שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽעִזִּ֔ים שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ מֵהַ֥ר גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated:
Ah, you are fair, my darling,
Ah, you are fair.
Your eyes are like doves
Behind your veil.
Your hair is like a flock of goats
Streaming down Mount Gilead.
Transliteration: hinakhe yafah raeyatiy hinakhe yafah eynayiikhe yvoniym mivaad letsamatekhe shaerekhe kheeder haiziym shegaleshu mehar gilead

Hebrew: שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הַקְּצוּב֔וֹת שֶׁעָל֖וּ מִן־הָרַחְצָ֑ה שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ מַתְאִימ֔וֹת וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Your teeth are like a flock of ewes
Climbing up from the washing pool;
All of them bear twins,
And not one loses her young.
Transliteration: shinayiikhe kheeder haketsuvvot shealu min-harachetsah shekhulam mateiymvot veshakhulah eyn vahem

Hebrew: כְּח֤וּט הַשָּׁנִי֙ שִׂפְתוֹתַ֔יִךְ וּמִדְבָּרֵ֖ךְ נָאוֶ֑ה כְּפֶ֤לַח הָֽרִמּוֹן֙ רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your lips are like a crimson thread,
Your mouth is lovely.
Your brow behind your veil
[Gleams] like a pomegranate split open.
Transliteration: khechut hashaniy shifetvotayiikhe umidevarekhe naveh khefelach harimvon rakatekhe mivaad letsamatekhe

Hebrew: כְּמִגְדַּ֤ל דָּוִיד֙ צַוָּארֵ֔ךְ בָּנ֖וּי לְתַלְפִּיּ֑וֹת אֶ֤לֶף הַמָּגֵן֙ תָּל֣וּי עָלָ֔יו כֹּ֖ל שִׁלְטֵ֥י הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated:
Your neck is like the Tower of David,
Built to hold weapons,
Hung with a thousand shields—
All the quivers of warriors.
Transliteration: khemigedal daviyd tsavarekhe vanuy letalefiyyvot elef hamagen taluy alayv khol shiletey hagivoriym

Hebrew: שְׁנֵ֥י שָׁדַ֛יִךְ כִּשְׁנֵ֥י עֳפָרִ֖ים תְּאוֹמֵ֣י צְבִיָּ֑ה הָרוֹעִ֖ים בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃
Translated:
Your breasts are like two fawns,
Twins of a gazelle,
Browsing among the lilies.
Transliteration: sheney shadayiikhe khisheney ofariym tevomey tseviyah harvoiym vashvoshaniym

Hebrew: עַ֤ד שֶׁיָּפ֙וּחַ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְנָ֖סוּ הַצְּלָלִ֑ים אֵ֤לֶךְ לִי֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר הַמּ֔וֹר וְאֶל־גִּבְעַ֖ת הַלְּבוֹנָֽה׃
Translated:
When the day blows gently
And the shadows flee,
I will betake me to the mount of myrrh,
To the hill of frankincense.
Transliteration: ad sheyafucha hayyvom venasu hatselaliym elekhe liy el-har hamvor veel-giveat halevvonah

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֤ךְ יָפָה֙ רַעְיָתִ֔י וּמ֖וּם אֵ֥ין בָּֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Every part of you is fair, my darling,
There is no blemish in you.
Transliteration: khulakhe yafah raeyatiy umum eyn vakhe {s}

Hebrew: אִתִּ֤י מִלְּבָנוֹן֙ כַּלָּ֔ה אִתִּ֖י מִלְּבָנ֣וֹן תָּב֑וֹאִי תָּשׁ֣וּרִי ׀ מֵרֹ֣אשׁ אֲמָנָ֗ה מֵרֹ֤אשׁ שְׂנִיר֙ וְחֶרְמ֔וֹן מִמְּעֹנ֣וֹת אֲרָי֔וֹת מֵֽהַרְרֵ֖י נְמֵרִֽים׃
Translated:
From Lebanon come with me;
From Lebanon, my bride, with me!
Trip down from Amana’s peak,
From the peak of Senir and Hermon,
From the dens of lions,
From the hills of leopards.
Transliteration: itiy milevanvon khalah itiy milevanvon tavvoiy tashuriy merosh amanah merosh sheniyr vecheremvon mimeonvot arayvot meharerey nemeriym

Hebrew: לִבַּבְתִּ֖נִי אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה לִבַּבְתִּ֙נִי֙ (באחד) [בְּאַחַ֣ת] מֵעֵינַ֔יִךְ בְּאַחַ֥ד עֲנָ֖ק מִצַּוְּרֹנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
You have captured my heart,
My own, my bride,
You have captured my heart
With one [glance] of your eyes,
With one coil of your necklace.
Transliteration: livavetiniy achotiy khalah livavetiniy (vchd) [veachat] meeynayiikhe veachad anak mitsaveronayiikhe

Hebrew: מַה־יָּפ֥וּ דֹדַ֖יִךְ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה מַה־טֹּ֤בוּ דֹדַ֙יִךְ֙ מִיַּ֔יִן וְרֵ֥יחַ שְׁמָנַ֖יִךְ מִכׇּל־בְּשָׂמִֽים׃
Translated:
How sweet is your love,
My own, my bride!
How much more delightful your love than wine,
Your ointments more fragrant
Than any spice!
Transliteration: mah-yafu dodayiikhe achotiy khalah mah-tovu dodayiikhe miyayiin vereycha shemanayiikhe mikhׇl-veshamiym

Hebrew: נֹ֛פֶת תִּטֹּ֥פְנָה שִׂפְתוֹתַ֖יִךְ כַּלָּ֑ה דְּבַ֤שׁ וְחָלָב֙ תַּ֣חַת לְשׁוֹנֵ֔ךְ וְרֵ֥יחַ שַׂלְמֹתַ֖יִךְ כְּרֵ֥יחַ לְבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Sweetness drops
From your lips, O bride;
Honey and milk
Are under your tongue;
And the scent of your robes
Is like the scent of Lebanon.
Transliteration: nofet titofenah shifetvotayiikhe khalah devash vechalav tachat leshvonekhe vereycha shalemotayiikhe khereycha levanvon

Hebrew: גַּ֥ן <small>׀</small> נָע֖וּל אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה גַּ֥ל נָע֖וּל מַעְיָ֥ן חָתֽוּם׃
Translated:
A garden locked
Is my own, my bride,
A fountain locked,
A sealed-up spring.
Transliteration: gan <small></small> naul achotiy khalah gal naul maeyan chatum

Hebrew: שְׁלָחַ֙יִךְ֙ פַּרְדֵּ֣ס רִמּוֹנִ֔ים עִ֖ם פְּרִ֣י מְגָדִ֑ים כְּפָרִ֖ים עִם־נְרָדִֽים׃
Translated:
Your limbs are an orchard of pomegranates
And of all luscious fruits,
Of henna and of nard—
Transliteration: shelachayiikhe faredes rimvoniym im feriy megadiym khefariym im-neradiym

Hebrew: נֵ֣רְדְּ ׀ וְכַרְכֹּ֗ם קָנֶה֙ וְקִנָּמ֔וֹן עִ֖ם כׇּל־עֲצֵ֣י לְבוֹנָ֑ה מֹ֚ר וַאֲהָל֔וֹת עִ֖ם כׇּל־רָאשֵׁ֥י בְשָׂמִֽים׃
Translated:
Nard and saffron,
Fragrant reed and cinnamon,
With all aromatic woods,
Myrrh and aloes—
All the choice perfumes.
Transliteration: nerede vekharekhom kaneh vekinamvon im khׇl-atsey levvonah mor vaahalvot im khׇl-rashey veshamiym

Hebrew: מַעְיַ֣ן גַּנִּ֔ים בְּאֵ֖ר מַ֣יִם חַיִּ֑ים וְנֹזְלִ֖ים מִן־לְבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
[You are] a garden spring,
A well of fresh water,
A rill of Lebanon.
Transliteration: maeyan ganiym veer mayiim chayiym venozeliym min-levanvon

Hebrew: ע֤וּרִי צָפוֹן֙ וּב֣וֹאִי תֵימָ֔ן הָפִ֥יחִי גַנִּ֖י יִזְּל֣וּ בְשָׂמָ֑יו יָבֹ֤א דוֹדִי֙ לְגַנּ֔וֹ וְיֹאכַ֖ל פְּרִ֥י מְגָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
Awake, O north wind,
Come, O south wind!
Blow upon my garden,
That its perfume may spread.
Let my beloved come to his garden
And enjoy its luscious fruits!
Transliteration: uriy tsafvon uvvoiy teyman hafiychiy ganiy yizelu veshamayv yavo dvodiy leganvo veyokhal feriy megadayv

Hebrew: בָּ֣אתִי לְגַנִּי֮ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּה֒ אָרִ֤יתִי מוֹרִי֙ עִם־בְּשָׂמִ֔י אָכַ֤לְתִּי יַעְרִי֙ עִם־דִּבְשִׁ֔י שָׁתִ֥יתִי יֵינִ֖י עִם־חֲלָבִ֑י אִכְל֣וּ רֵעִ֔ים שְׁת֥וּ וְשִׁכְר֖וּ דּוֹדִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
I have come to my garden,
My own, my bride;
I have plucked my myrrh and spice,
Eaten my honey and honeycomb,
Drunk my wine and my milk.

Eat, lovers, and drink:
Drink deep of love!
Transliteration: vatiy leganiy achotiy khalah ariytiy mvoriy im-veshamiy akhaletiy yaeriy im-diveshiy shatiytiy eiyniy im-chalaviy ikhelu reiym shetu veshikheru dvodiym {s}

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְשֵׁנָ֖ה וְלִבִּ֣י עֵ֑ר ק֣וֹל ׀ דּוֹדִ֣י דוֹפֵ֗ק פִּתְחִי־לִ֞י אֲחֹתִ֤י רַעְיָתִי֙ יוֹנָתִ֣י תַמָּתִ֔י שֶׁרֹּאשִׁי֙ נִמְלָא־טָ֔ל קְוֻצּוֹתַ֖י רְסִ֥יסֵי לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
I was asleep,
But my heart was wakeful.
Hark, my beloved knocks!
“Let me in, my own,
My darling, my faultless dove!
For my head is drenched with dew,
My locks with the damp of night.”
Transliteration: aniy yeshenah veliviy er kvol dvodiy dvofek fitechiy-liy achotiy raeyatiy yvonatiy tamatiy sheroshiy nimela-tal kevutsvotay resiysey layelah

Hebrew: פָּשַׁ֙טְתִּי֙ אֶת־כֻּתׇּנְתִּ֔י אֵיכָ֖כָה אֶלְבָּשֶׁ֑נָּה רָחַ֥צְתִּי אֶת־רַגְלַ֖י אֵיכָ֥כָה אֲטַנְּפֵֽם׃
Translated:
I had taken off my robe—
Was I to don it again?
I had bathed my feet—
Was I to soil them again?
Transliteration: fashatetiy et-khutׇnetiy eykhakhah elevashenah rachatsetiy et-ragelay eykhakhah atanefem

Hebrew: דּוֹדִ֗י שָׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ מִן־הַחֹ֔ר וּמֵעַ֖י הָמ֥וּ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
My beloved took his hand off the latch,
And my heart was stirred for him.
Transliteration: dvodiy shalach yadvo min-hachor umeay hamu alayv

Hebrew: קַ֥מְתִּֽי אֲנִ֖י לִפְתֹּ֣חַ לְדוֹדִ֑י וְיָדַ֣י נָֽטְפוּ־מ֗וֹר וְאֶצְבְּעֹתַי֙ מ֣וֹר עֹבֵ֔ר עַ֖ל כַּפּ֥וֹת הַמַּנְעֽוּל׃
Translated:
I rose to let in my beloved;
My hands dripped myrrh—
My fingers, flowing myrrh—
Upon the handles of the bolt.
Transliteration: kametiy aniy lifetocha ledvodiy veyaday natefu-mvor veetseveotay mvor over al khafvot hamaneul

Hebrew: פָּתַ֤חְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ לְדוֹדִ֔י וְדוֹדִ֖י חָמַ֣ק עָבָ֑ר נַפְשִׁי֙ יָֽצְאָ֣ה בְדַבְּר֔וֹ בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֙יהוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א מְצָאתִ֔יהוּ קְרָאתִ֖יו וְלֹ֥א עָנָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I opened the door for my beloved,
But my beloved had turned and gone.
I was faint because of what he said.
I sought, but found him not;
I called, but he did not answer.
Transliteration: fatachetiy aniy ledvodiy vedvodiy chamak avar nafeshiy yatseah vedavervo vikashetiyhu velo metsatiyhu keratiyv velo ananiy

Hebrew: מְצָאֻ֧נִי הַשֹּׁמְרִ֛ים הַסֹּבְבִ֥ים בָּעִ֖יר הִכּ֣וּנִי פְצָע֑וּנִי נָשְׂא֤וּ אֶת־רְדִידִי֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י שֹׁמְרֵ֖י הַחֹמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I met the watchmen
Who patrol the town;
They struck me, they bruised me.
The guards of the walls
Stripped me of my mantle.
Transliteration: metsauniy hashomeriym hasoveviym vaiyr hikhuniy fetsauniy nasheu et-rediydiy mealay shomerey hachomvot

Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּנ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם אִֽם־תִּמְצְאוּ֙ אֶת־דּוֹדִ֔י מַה־תַּגִּ֣ידוּ ל֔וֹ שֶׁחוֹלַ֥ת אַהֲבָ֖ה אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I adjure you, O maidens of Jerusalem!
If you meet my beloved, tell him this:
That I am faint with love.
Transliteration: hishevaetiy etekhem venvot yerushala͏im im-timetseu et-dvodiy mah-tagiydu lvo shechvolat ahavah aniy

Hebrew: מַה־דּוֹדֵ֣ךְ מִדּ֔וֹד הַיָּפָ֖ה בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים מַה־דּוֹדֵ֣ךְ מִדּ֔וֹד שֶׁכָּ֖כָה הִשְׁבַּעְתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
How is your beloved better than another,
O fairest of women?
How is your beloved better than another
That you adjure us so?
Transliteration: mah-dvodekhe midvod hayafah vanashiym mah-dvodekhe midvod shekhakhah hishevaetanu

Hebrew: דּוֹדִ֥י צַח֙ וְאָד֔וֹם דָּג֖וּל מֵרְבָבָֽה׃
Translated:
My beloved is clear-skinned and ruddy,
Preeminent among ten thousand.
Transliteration: dvodiy tsach veadvom dagul merevavah

Hebrew: רֹאשׁ֖וֹ כֶּ֣תֶם פָּ֑ז קְוֻצּוֹתָיו֙ תַּלְתַּלִּ֔ים שְׁחֹר֖וֹת כָּעוֹרֵֽב׃
Translated:
His head is finest gold,
His locks are curled
And black as a raven.
Transliteration: roshvo khetem faz kevutsvotayv taletaliym shechorvot khavorev

Hebrew: עֵינָ֕יו כְּיוֹנִ֖ים עַל־אֲפִ֣יקֵי מָ֑יִם רֹֽחֲצוֹת֙ בֶּֽחָלָ֔ב יֹשְׁב֖וֹת עַל־מִלֵּֽאת׃
Translated:
His eyes are like doves
By watercourses,
Bathed in milk,
Set by a brimming pool.
Transliteration: eynayv kheyvoniym al-afiykey mayiim rochatsvot vechalav yoshevvot al-milet

Hebrew: לְחָיָו֙ כַּעֲרוּגַ֣ת הַבֹּ֔שֶׂם מִגְדְּל֖וֹת מֶרְקָחִ֑ים שִׂפְתוֹתָיו֙ שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּ֔ים נֹטְפ֖וֹת מ֥וֹר עֹבֵֽר׃
Translated:
His cheeks are like beds of spices,
Banks of perfume
His lips are like lilies;
They drip flowing myrrh.
Transliteration: lechayav khaarugat havoshem migedelvot merekachiym shifetvotayv shvoshaniym notefvot mvor over

Hebrew: יָדָיו֙ גְּלִילֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב מְמֻלָּאִ֖ים בַּתַּרְשִׁ֑ישׁ מֵעָיו֙ עֶ֣שֶׁת שֵׁ֔ן מְעֻלֶּ֖פֶת סַפִּירִֽים׃
Translated:
His hands are rods of gold,
Studded with beryl;
His belly a tablet of ivory,
Adorned with sapphires.
Transliteration: yadayv geliyley zahav memulaiym vatareshiysh meayv eshet shen meulefet safiyriym

Hebrew: שׁוֹקָיו֙ עַמּ֣וּדֵי שֵׁ֔שׁ מְיֻסָּדִ֖ים עַל־אַדְנֵי־פָ֑ז מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ כַּלְּבָנ֔וֹן בָּח֖וּר כָּאֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated:
His legs are like marble pillars
Set in sockets of fine gold.
He is majestic as Lebanon,
Stately as the cedars.
Transliteration: shvokayv amudey shesh meyusadiym al-adeney-faz mareehu khalevanvon vachur khaaraziym

Hebrew: חִכּוֹ֙ מַֽמְתַקִּ֔ים וְכֻלּ֖וֹ מַחֲמַדִּ֑ים זֶ֤ה דוֹדִי֙ וְזֶ֣ה רֵעִ֔י בְּנ֖וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
His mouth is delicious
And all of him is delightful.
Such is my beloved,
Such is my darling,
O maidens of Jerusalem!
Transliteration: chikhvo mametakiym vekhulvo machamadiym zeh dvodiy vezeh reiy venvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: אָ֚נָה הָלַ֣ךְ דּוֹדֵ֔ךְ הַיָּפָ֖ה בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים אָ֚נָה פָּנָ֣ה דוֹדֵ֔ךְ וּנְבַקְשֶׁ֖נּוּ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
“Whither has your beloved gone,
O fairest of women?
Whither has your beloved turned?
Let us seek him with you.”
Transliteration: anah halakhe dvodekhe hayafah vanashiym anah fanah dvodekhe unevakeshenu imakhe

Hebrew: דּוֹדִי֙ יָרַ֣ד לְגַנּ֔וֹ לַעֲרֻג֖וֹת הַבֹּ֑שֶׂם לִרְעוֹת֙ בַּגַּנִּ֔ים וְלִלְקֹ֖ט שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃
Translated:
My beloved has gone down to his garden,
To the beds of spices,
To browse in the gardens
And to pick lilies.
Transliteration: dvodiy yarad leganvo laarugvot havoshem lirevot vaganiym velilekot shvoshaniym

Hebrew: אֲנִ֤י לְדוֹדִי֙ וְדוֹדִ֣י לִ֔י הָרֹעֶ֖ה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
I am my beloved’s
And my beloved is mine;
He browses among the lilies.
Transliteration: aniy ledvodiy vedvodiy liy haroeh vashvoshaniym {s}

Hebrew: יָפָ֨ה אַ֤תְּ רַעְיָתִי֙ כְּתִרְצָ֔ה נָאוָ֖ה כִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם אֲיֻמָּ֖ה כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
You are beautiful, my darling, as Tirzah,
Comely as Jerusalem,
Awesome as bannered hosts.
Transliteration: yafah ate raeyatiy khetiretsah navah khiyrushala͏im ayumah khanidegalvot

Hebrew: הָסֵ֤בִּי עֵינַ֙יִךְ֙ מִנֶּגְדִּ֔י שֶׁ֥הֵ֖ם הִרְהִיבֻ֑נִי שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽעִזִּ֔ים שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ מִן־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated:
Turn your eyes away from me,
For they overwhelm me!
Your hair is like a flock of goats
Streaming down from Gilead.
Transliteration: haseviy eynayiikhe minegediy shehem hirehiyvuniy shaerekhe kheeder haiziym shegaleshu min-hagilead

Hebrew: שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽרְחֵלִ֔ים שֶׁעָל֖וּ מִן־הָרַחְצָ֑ה שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ מַתְאִימ֔וֹת וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Your teeth are like a flock of ewes
Climbing up from the washing pool;
All of them bear twins,
And not one loses her young.
Transliteration: shinayiikhe kheeder harecheliym shealu min-harachetsah shekhulam mateiymvot veshakhulah eyn vahem

Hebrew: כְּפֶ֤לַח הָרִמּוֹן֙ רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Your brow behind your veil
[Gleams] like a pomegranate split open.
Transliteration: khefelach harimvon rakatekhe mivaad letsamatekhe

Hebrew: שִׁשִּׁ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ מְלָכ֔וֹת וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים פִּֽילַגְשִׁ֑ים וַעֲלָמ֖וֹת אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
There are sixty queens,
And eighty concubines,
And damsels without number.
Transliteration: shishiym hemah melakhvot ushemoniym fiylageshiym vaalamvot eyn misefar

Hebrew: אַחַ֥ת הִיא֙ יוֹנָתִ֣י תַמָּתִ֔י אַחַ֥ת הִיא֙ לְאִמָּ֔הּ בָּרָ֥ה הִ֖יא לְיֽוֹלַדְתָּ֑הּ רָא֤וּהָ בָנוֹת֙ וַֽיְאַשְּׁר֔וּהָ מְלָכ֥וֹת וּפִֽילַגְשִׁ֖ים וַֽיְהַלְלֽוּהָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Only one is my dove,
My perfect one,
The only one of her mother,
The delight of her who bore her.
Maidens see and acclaim her;
Queens and concubines, and praise her.
Transliteration: achat hiy yvonatiy tamatiy achat hiy leimah varah hiy leyvoladetah rauha vanvot vayeasheruha melakhvot ufiylageshiym vayehaleluha {s}

Hebrew: מִי־זֹ֥את הַנִּשְׁקָפָ֖ה כְּמוֹ־שָׁ֑חַר יָפָ֣ה כַלְּבָנָ֗ה בָּרָה֙ כַּֽחַמָּ֔ה אֲיֻמָּ֖ה כַּנִּדְגָּלֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated:
Who is she that shines through like the dawn,
Beautiful as the moon,
Radiant as the sun
Awesome as bannered hosts?
Transliteration: miy-zot hanishekafah khemvo-shachar yafah khalevanah varah khachamah ayumah khanidegalvot {s}

Hebrew: אֶל־גִּנַּ֤ת אֱגוֹז֙ יָרַ֔דְתִּי לִרְא֖וֹת בְּאִבֵּ֣י הַנָּ֑חַל לִרְאוֹת֙ הֲפָֽרְחָ֣ה הַגֶּ֔פֶן הֵנֵ֖צוּ הָרִמֹּנִֽים׃
Translated:
I went down to the nut grove
To see the budding of the vale;
To see if the vines had blossomed,
If the pomegranates were in bloom.
Transliteration: el-ginat egvoz yaradetiy lirevot veivey hanachal lirevot hafarechah hagefen henetsu harimoniym

Hebrew: לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי נַפְשִׁ֣י שָׂמַ֔תְנִי מַרְכְּב֖וֹת עַמִּ֥י נָדִֽיב׃
Translated:
Before I knew it,
My desire set me
Mid the chariots of Ammi-nadib.
Transliteration: lo yadaetiy nafeshiy shamateniy marekhevvot amiy nadiyv

Hebrew: שׁ֤וּבִי שׁ֙וּבִי֙ הַשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית שׁ֥וּבִי שׁ֖וּבִי וְנֶחֱזֶה־בָּ֑ךְ מַֽה־תֶּחֱזוּ֙ בַּשּׁ֣וּלַמִּ֔ית כִּמְחֹלַ֖ת הַֽמַּחֲנָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Turn back, turn back,
O maid of Shulem!
Turn back, turn back,
That we may gaze upon you.
“Why will you gaze at the Shulammite
In the Mahanaim dance?”
Transliteration: shuviy shuviy hashulamiyt shuviy shuviy venechezeh-vakhe mah-techezu vashulamiyt khimecholat hamachanayiim

Hebrew: מַה־יָּפ֧וּ פְעָמַ֛יִךְ בַּנְּעָלִ֖ים בַּת־נָדִ֑יב חַמּוּקֵ֣י יְרֵכַ֔יִךְ כְּמ֣וֹ חֲלָאִ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֥י אׇמָּֽן׃
Translated:
How lovely are your feet in sandals,
O daughter of nobles!
Your rounded thighs are like jewels,
The work of a master’s hand.
Transliteration: mah-yafu feamayiikhe vanealiym vat-nadiyv chamukey yerekhayiikhe khemvo chalaiym maasheh yedey ׇman

Hebrew: שׇׁרְרֵךְ֙ אַגַּ֣ן הַסַּ֔הַר אַל־יֶחְסַ֖ר הַמָּ֑זֶג בִּטְנֵךְ֙ עֲרֵמַ֣ת חִטִּ֔ים סוּגָ֖ה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃
Translated:
Your navel is like a round goblet—
Let mixed wine not be lacking!—
Your belly like a heap of wheat
Hedged about with lilies.
Transliteration: shׇrerekhe agan hasahar al-yechesar hamazeg vitenekhe aremat chitiym sugah vashvoshaniym

Hebrew: שְׁנֵ֥י שָׁדַ֛יִךְ כִּשְׁנֵ֥י עֳפָרִ֖ים תׇּאֳמֵ֥י צְבִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Your breasts are like two fawns,
Twins of a gazelle.
Transliteration: sheney shadayiikhe khisheney ofariym tׇomey tseviyah

Hebrew: צַוָּארֵ֖ךְ כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל הַשֵּׁ֑ן עֵינַ֜יִךְ בְּרֵכ֣וֹת בְּחֶשְׁבּ֗וֹן עַל־שַׁ֙עַר֙ בַּת־רַבִּ֔ים אַפֵּךְ֙ כְּמִגְדַּ֣ל הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן צוֹפֶ֖ה פְּנֵ֥י דַמָּֽשֶׂק׃
Translated:
Your neck is like a tower of ivory,
Your eyes like pools in Heshbon
By the gate of Bath-rabbim,
Your nose like the Lebanon tower
That faces toward Damascus.
Transliteration: tsavarekhe khemigedal hashen eynayiikhe verekhvot vecheshevvon al-shaar vat-raviym afekhe khemigedal halevanvon tsvofeh feney damashek

Hebrew: רֹאשֵׁ֤ךְ עָלַ֙יִךְ֙ כַּכַּרְמֶ֔ל וְדַלַּ֥ת רֹאשֵׁ֖ךְ כָּאַרְגָּמָ֑ן מֶ֖לֶךְ אָס֥וּר בָּרְהָטִֽים׃
Translated:
The head upon you is like crimson wool,
The locks of your head are like purple—
A king is held captive in the tresses.
Transliteration: roshekhe alayiikhe khakharemel vedalat roshekhe khaaregaman melekhe asur varehatiym

Hebrew: מַה־יָּפִית֙ וּמַה־נָּעַ֔מְתְּ אַהֲבָ֖ה בַּתַּֽעֲנוּגִֽים׃
Translated:
How fair you are, how beautiful!
O Love, with all its rapture!
Transliteration: mah-yafiyt umah-naamete ahavah vataanugiym

Hebrew: זֹ֤את קֽוֹמָתֵךְ֙ דָּֽמְתָ֣ה לְתָמָ֔ר וְשָׁדַ֖יִךְ לְאַשְׁכֹּלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Your stately form is like the palm,
Your breasts are like clusters.
Transliteration: zot kvomatekhe dametah letamar veshadayiikhe leashekholvot

Hebrew: אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶעֱלֶ֣ה בְתָמָ֔ר אֹֽחֲזָ֖ה בְּסַנְסִנָּ֑יו וְיִֽהְיוּ־נָ֤א שָׁדַ֙יִךְ֙ כְּאֶשְׁכְּל֣וֹת הַגֶּ֔פֶן וְרֵ֥יחַ אַפֵּ֖ךְ כַּתַּפּוּחִֽים׃
Translated:
I say: Let me climb the palm,
Let me take hold of its branches;
Let your breasts be like clusters of grapes,
Your breath like the fragrance of apples,
Transliteration: amaretiy eeleh vetamar ochazah vesanesinayv veyiheyu-na shadayiikhe kheeshekhelvot hagefen vereycha afekhe khatafuchiym

Hebrew: וְחִכֵּ֕ךְ כְּיֵ֥ין הַטּ֛וֹב הוֹלֵ֥ךְ לְדוֹדִ֖י לְמֵישָׁרִ֑ים דּוֹבֵ֖ב שִׂפְתֵ֥י יְשֵׁנִֽים׃
Translated:
And your mouth like choicest wine.
“Let it flow to my beloved as new wine
Gliding over the lips of sleepers.”
Transliteration: vechikhekhe kheeiyn hatvov hvolekhe ledvodiy lemeyshariym dvovev shifetey yesheniym

Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י לְדוֹדִ֔י וְעָלַ֖י תְּשׁוּקָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I am my beloved’s,
And his desire is for me.
Transliteration: aniy ledvodiy vealay teshukatvo {s}

Hebrew: לְכָ֤ה דוֹדִי֙ נֵצֵ֣א הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה נָלִ֖ינָה בַּכְּפָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Come, my beloved,
Let us go into the open;
Let us lodge among the henna shrubs.
Transliteration: lekhah dvodiy netse hashadeh naliynah vakhefariym

Hebrew: נַשְׁכִּ֙ימָה֙ לַכְּרָמִ֔ים נִרְאֶ֞ה אִם־פָּֽרְחָ֤ה הַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ פִּתַּ֣ח הַסְּמָדַ֔ר הֵנֵ֖צוּ הָרִמּוֹנִ֑ים שָׁ֛ם אֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־דֹּדַ֖י לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Let us go early to the vineyards;
Let us see if the vine has flowered,
If its blossoms have opened,
If the pomegranates are in bloom.
There I will give my love to you.
Transliteration: nashekhiymah lakheramiym nireeh im-farechah hagefen fitach hasemadar henetsu harimvoniym sham eten et-doday lakhe

Hebrew: הַֽדּוּדָאִ֣ים נָֽתְנוּ־רֵ֗יחַ וְעַל־פְּתָחֵ֙ינוּ֙ כׇּל־מְגָדִ֔ים חֲדָשִׁ֖ים גַּם־יְשָׁנִ֑ים דּוֹדִ֖י צָפַ֥נְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
The mandrakes yield their fragrance,
At our doors are all choice fruits;
Both freshly picked and long-stored
Have I kept, my beloved, for you.
Transliteration: hadudaiym natenu-reycha veal-fetacheynu khׇl-megadiym chadashiym gam-yeshaniym dvodiy tsafanetiy lakhe

Hebrew: מִ֤י יִתֶּנְךָ֙ כְּאָ֣ח לִ֔י יוֹנֵ֖ק שְׁדֵ֣י אִמִּ֑י אֶֽמְצָאֲךָ֤ בַחוּץ֙ אֶשָּׁ֣קְךָ֔ גַּ֖ם לֹא־יָבֻ֥זוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
If only it could be as with a brother,
As if you had nursed at my mother’s breast:
Then I could kiss you
When I met you in the street,
And no one would despise me.
Transliteration: miy yitenekha kheach liy yvonek shedey imiy emetsaakha vachuts eshakekha gam lo-yavuzu liy

Hebrew: אֶנְהָֽגְךָ֗ אֲבִֽיאֲךָ֛ אֶל־בֵּ֥ית אִמִּ֖י תְּלַמְּדֵ֑נִי אַשְׁקְךָ֙ מִיַּ֣יִן הָרֶ֔קַח מֵעֲסִ֖יס רִמֹּנִֽי׃
Translated:
I would lead you, I would bring you
To the house of my mother,
Of her who taught me—
I would let you drink of the spiced wine,
Of my pomegranate juice.
Transliteration: enehagekha aviyakha el-veyt imiy telamedeniy ashekekha miyayiin harekach measiys rimoniy

Hebrew: שְׂמֹאלוֹ֙ תַּ֣חַת רֹאשִׁ֔י וִֽימִינ֖וֹ תְּחַבְּקֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
His left hand was under my head,
His right hand caressed me.
Transliteration: shemolvo tachat roshiy viymiynvo techavekeniy

Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּנ֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם מַה־תָּעִ֧ירוּ ׀ וּֽמַה־תְּעֹ֥רְר֛וּ אֶת־הָאַהֲבָ֖ה עַ֥ד שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
I adjure you, O maidens of Jerusalem:
Do not wake or rouse
Love until it please!
Transliteration: hishevaetiy etekhem venvot yerushala͏im mah-taiyru umah-teoreru et-haahavah ad shetechefats {s}

Hebrew: מִ֣י זֹ֗את עֹלָה֙ מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר מִתְרַפֶּ֖קֶת עַל־דּוֹדָ֑הּ תַּ֤חַת הַתַּפּ֙וּחַ֙ עֽוֹרַרְתִּ֔יךָ שָׁ֚מָּה חִבְּלַ֣תְךָ אִמֶּ֔ךָ שָׁ֖מָּה חִבְּלָ֥ה יְלָדַֽתְךָ׃
Translated:
Who is she that comes up from the desert,
Leaning upon her beloved?

Under the apple tree I roused you;
It was there your mother conceived you,
There she who bore you conceived you.
Transliteration: miy zot olah min-hamidevar miterafeket al-dvodah tachat hatafucha voraretiykha shamah chivelatekha imekha shamah chivelah yeladatekha

Hebrew: שִׂימֵ֨נִי כַֽחוֹתָ֜ם עַל־לִבֶּ֗ךָ כַּֽחוֹתָם֙ עַל־זְרוֹעֶ֔ךָ כִּֽי־עַזָּ֤ה כַמָּ֙וֶת֙ אַהֲבָ֔ה קָשָׁ֥ה כִשְׁא֖וֹל קִנְאָ֑ה רְשָׁפֶ֕יהָ רִשְׁפֵּ֕י אֵ֖שׁ שַׁלְהֶ֥בֶתְיָֽה׃
Translated:
Let me be a seal upon your heart,
Like the seal upon your hand.
For love is fierce as death,
Passion is mighty as Sheol;
Its darts are darts of fire,
A blazing flame.
Transliteration: shiymeniy khachvotam al-livekha khachvotam al-zervoekha khiy-azah khamavet ahavah kashah khishevol kineah reshafeyha rishefey esh shaleheveteyah

Hebrew: מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֗ים לֹ֤א יֽוּכְלוּ֙ לְכַבּ֣וֹת אֶת־הָֽאַהֲבָ֔ה וּנְהָר֖וֹת לֹ֣א יִשְׁטְפ֑וּהָ אִם־יִתֵּ֨ן אִ֜ישׁ אֶת־כׇּל־ה֤וֹן בֵּיתוֹ֙ בָּאַהֲבָ֔ה בּ֖וֹז יָב֥וּזוּ לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Vast floods cannot quench love,
Nor rivers drown it.
If a man offered all his wealth for love,
He would be laughed to scorn.
Transliteration: mayiim raviym lo yukhelu lekhavvot et-haahavah uneharvot lo yishetefuha im-yiten iysh et-khׇl-hvon veytvo vaahavah vvoz yavuzu lvo {s}

Hebrew: אָח֥וֹת לָ֙נוּ֙ קְטַנָּ֔ה וְשָׁדַ֖יִם אֵ֣ין לָ֑הּ מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶׂה֙ לַאֲחֹתֵ֔נוּ בַּיּ֖וֹם שֶׁיְּדֻבַּר־בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
“We have a little sister,
Whose breasts are not yet formed.
What shall we do for our sister
When she is spoken for?
Transliteration: achvot lanu ketanah veshadayiim eyn lah mah-naasheh laachotenu vayyvom sheyeduvar-vah

Hebrew: אִם־חוֹמָ֣ה הִ֔יא נִבְנֶ֥ה עָלֶ֖יהָ טִ֣ירַת כָּ֑סֶף וְאִם־דֶּ֣לֶת הִ֔יא נָצ֥וּר עָלֶ֖יהָ ל֥וּחַ אָֽרֶז׃
Translated:
If she be a wall,
We will build upon it a silver battlement;
If she be a door,
We will panel it in cedar.”
Transliteration: im-chvomah hiy niveneh aleyha tiyrat khasef veim-delet hiy natsur aleyha lucha arez

Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י חוֹמָ֔ה וְשָׁדַ֖י כַּמִּגְדָּל֑וֹת אָ֛ז הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינָ֖יו כְּמוֹצְאֵ֥ת שָׁלֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated:
I am a wall,
My breasts are like towers.
So I became in his eyes
As one who finds favor.
Transliteration: aniy chvomah veshaday khamigedalvot az hayiytiy veeynayv khemvotseet shalvom {f}

Hebrew: כֶּ֣רֶם הָיָ֤ה לִשְׁלֹמֹה֙ בְּבַ֣עַל הָמ֔וֹן נָתַ֥ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֖רֶם לַנֹּטְרִ֑ים אִ֛ישׁ יָבִ֥א בְּפִרְי֖וֹ אֶ֥לֶף כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated:
Solomon had a vineyard
In Baal-hamon.
He had to post guards in the vineyard:
A man would give for its fruit
A thousand pieces of silver.
Transliteration: kherem hayah lishelomoh vevaal hamvon natan et-hakherem lanoteriym iysh yavi vefireyvo elef khasef

Hebrew: כַּרְמִ֥י שֶׁלִּ֖י לְפָנָ֑י הָאֶ֤לֶף לְךָ֙ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וּמָאתַ֖יִם לְנֹטְרִ֥ים אֶת־פִּרְיֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I have my very own vineyard:
You may have the thousand, O Solomon,
And the guards of the fruit two hundred!
Transliteration: kharemiy sheliy lefanay haelef lekha shelomoh umatayiim lenoteriym et-fireyvo

Hebrew: הַיּוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת בַּגַּנִּ֗ים חֲבֵרִ֛ים מַקְשִׁיבִ֥ים לְקוֹלֵ֖ךְ הַשְׁמִיעִֽנִי׃
Translated:
O you who linger in the garden,
A lover is listening;
Let me hear your voice.
Transliteration: hayyvoshevet vaganiym chaveriym makeshiyviym lekvolekhe hashemiyiniy

Hebrew: בְּרַ֣ח ׀ דּוֹדִ֗י וּֽדְמֵה־לְךָ֤ לִצְבִי֙ א֚וֹ לְעֹ֣פֶר הָֽאַיָּלִ֔ים עַ֖ל הָרֵ֥י בְשָׂמִֽים׃
Translated:
“Hurry, my beloved,
Swift as a gazelle or a young stag,
To the hills of spices!”
Transliteration: verach dvodiy udemeh-lekha litseviy vo leofer haayaliym al harey veshamiym
